relations.Subject: companies
relations.Description:
State-backed companies have primarily led finance and investment in the 
energy sector.

relations.Subject: challenges
relations.Description:
Security challenges cost the State 17 per cent and 
22.1 per cent of its budgetary resources in 2021 and 2022, respectively, severely constraining 
investments in the productive sector.

relations.Subject: UNDP
relations.Description:
Given its decades-long experience supporting local governance in the hinterlands and key 
national governance institutions, UNDP will expand its governance offer to help strengthen 
the social contract between the people and the State, stabilize communities, and build
resilience, particularly in borderlands and rural areas.

relations.Subject: UNDP
relations.Description:
In response to the national policy on modernization of government services for a more 
effective civil service and transformed State structure, UNDP will prioritize the security of 
territories through a mutual security and civilian coordination mechanism and funding.

relations.Subject: approach
relations.Description:
At the European level a proactive approach involves all Member States in promoting a concerted 
international response to climate change.

relations.Subject: Agency
Table
relations.Description:
Table 8 shows the types of incentives that have been implemented by EU 
Member States in order to help achieve the targets set up in their various NEEAPs.

relations.Subject: database
relations.Description:
States database describes both the measures and statistical evidence of how well the measures have 
performed.

relations.Subject: Fund
relations.Description:
In addition, the EE Fund will secure an initial fund from the State Budget based 
on the State Budget Law.
